crosswrench(1) General Commands Manual crosswrench(1)

NAME

crosswrench — python wheel installer

SYNOPSIS

crosswrench --destdir=directory --python=path-to-python-executable --wheel=path-to-wheel [--installer=name] [--script-prefix=prefix] [--script-suffix=suffix]

crosswrench --license

crosswrench --license-libs

crosswrench --help

DESCRIPTION

crosswrench installs the python wheel specified by --wheel into the directories supplied by the python executable specified by --python prepended by the argument given to --destdir .

crosswrench is trying to support version 1.0 of the wheel specification.

Options:

--destdir=directory
specify root directory to install into
--python=path
path to python interpreter
--wheel=path
path to wheel file
--installer=name
put name into the INSTALLER file instead of crosswrench
--script-prefix=prefix
prefix to add to script names
--script-suffix=suffix
suffix to add to script names
--licence
show license
--license-libs
show licenses of libraries used by crosswrench
--help
show help

STANDARDS

crosswrench is trying to be compliant with the python packaging standards at https://packaging.python.org/en/latest/specifications/

Specifically:

Binary distribution format, https://packaging.python.org/en/latest/specifications/binary-distribution-format/.

Record installed projects, excluding direct URL, https://packaging.python.org/en/latest/specifications/recording-installed-projects/.

Entry points specification, https://packaging.python.org/en/latest/specifications/enty-points/.
